properties.description: Notebook that implements upsert function using PyOdbc

source: # Re-usable Upsert function for Azure Synapse Analytics SQL Dedicated Pool

server="<Azure Synapse DedicatedSQLPool>"
database = "<Azure Synapse DedicatedSQLPool/Azure SQL>"
sqlUidSecret = "Azure Key Vault Secret for DedicatedSQLPool user name"
sqlPwdSecret = "Azure Key Vault Secret for DedicatedSQLPool password"

def upsertSdp(df,SchemaStagingTable,StagingTable, SchemaTargetTable, TargetTable, KeyColumns, DeltaColumn=None) :
# ##########################################################################################################################  
# Function: upsertSdp
# Performs a Merge/Upsert action on a Azure SQL table
# 
# Parameters:
# df = Input dataframe
# StagingTable = Name of Table used to temporarily stage the input data frame
# SchemaStagingTable = Database schema of staging table
# SchemaTargetTable = Database schema of target table
# TargetTable  = Name of Target Table
# KeyColumns = List of columns that uniquely defines a record in input dataframe
# DeltaColumn = Name of watermark column in input dataframe
#
# Returns:
# None
# ##########################################################################################################################  
    insertSdpTable(df, SchemaStagingTable,StagingTable, "overwrite")

    insertCols=""
    updateCols=""
    whereCols =""
    keyCols = ""

    # MATCHED Clause of MERGE
    for keyCol in KeyColumns:
        keyCols = keyCols + "source." + keyCol + " = " + "target." + keyCol + " and "

    whereClause = keyCols
    #Tidy up where clause and remove last "and"
    remove="and"
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    whereClause = whereClause[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]

    # INSERT and UPDATE part of MERGE
    for col in df.schema.fieldNames():
        insertCols = insertCols + col + ","
        if col not in KeyColumns: # Exclude key columns in update statement
         updateCols =  updateCols + "target." + col + " = " + "source." + col + ","

    #Tidy up insertCols and remove last ","
    remove=","
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    insertCols = insertCols[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]  

    #Tidy up insertCols and remove last ","
    remove=","
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    updateCols = updateCols[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]   

    # MERGE Statement in full
    mergeSQL= "MERGE INTO " + SchemaTargetTable +"." + TargetTable + " AS target" +  " USING " + SchemaStagingTable + "." + StagingTable + " AS source" + " ON "
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + whereClause

    # WHEN MATCHED
    if DeltaColumn != None:
        mergeSQL =  mergeSQL + " WHEN MATCHED AND " + "source." + DeltaColumn + " > " + "target." + DeltaColumn 
    else:
        mergeSQL =  mergeSQL + " WHEN MATCHED"

    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " THEN UPDATE SET " + updateCols

    # WHEN NOT MATCHED BY TARGET
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " WHEN NOT MATCHED BY TARGET " # including BY TARGET clause for Synapse requires the table to be Hash Distributed
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " THEN INSERT " +  "("+ insertCols +")" + " VALUES " + " ( "+ insertCols +" ) "

    mergeSQL = mergeSQL +";"
    
    #Execute Merge Statement using Pyodbc
    uid = getSecret(sqlUidSecret)
    pwd = getSecret(sqlPwdSecret)
 
    try:
        cnxn = pyodbc.connect("DRIVER={ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server};SERVER=" + server + ";DATABASE=" + database + ";UID=" + uid + ";PWD=" + pwd )
        cursor = cnxn.cursor()
        cnxn.autocommit = True

        cursor.execute(mergeSQL)
    except Exception as e:
        print("Upsert to {}.{} failed with exception:".format(SchemaTargetTable,TargetTable))
        raise e

    print("Upsert statement executed successfully : {} ".format(mergeSQL))
    return
